data.text: Dughiar kamɨn, Asiriaba bar arazir kurabar Judabagh amima, Hesekia arɨmariam inigha atam areme. Ezɨ Emosɨn otarim Aisaia ghuava an ganigha kamaghɨn a mɨgei, “Ikiavɨra Itir God kamaghɨn mɨgei, ‘Nɨn arɨmariam gɨvaghan kogham, a ikɨvɨra ikɨtɨ nɨ ovegham. Kamaghɨn amizɨ, nɨ gumazamizir nɨn dɨpenimɨn itibav kemeghtɨ, me nɨn ingangariba bar dar amu dar kɨrigh.’ ”
Ezɨ Hesekia akar kam baregha, uan guam isa a itir dɨpenimɨn averiamɨn bɨrimɨn gara, Ikiavɨra Itir God ko mɨgɨa ghaze,

38:3 Nehemia 13:14“O Ikiavɨra Itir God, kɨ uan navir averiamɨn aven nɨ baghavɨra ikia nɨn ifongiamɨn gɨn ghua, bar guizbangɨra zurara nɨn ingangarim deravɨra a gamuavɨra iti. Kamaghɨn amizɨ, kɨ amizir ingangariba, nɨ dagh nɨghnɨgh na ateghtɨ, kɨ ovengan kogham.” Egha Hesekia Ikiavɨra Itir God ko mɨkemegha gɨvagha, bar puvɨram azi.
Ezɨ Ikiavɨra Itir God ua kamaghɨn Aisaia mɨgei,

“Nɨ mangɨ kamaghɨn Hesekia mɨkemegh, ‘Kɨ Ikiavɨra Itir God, nɨn inazir afeziam Devitɨn God, kɨ nɨn azangsɨzim baregha nɨn temeribar ganigha gɨfa. Kamaghɨn amizɨ, kɨ nɨ ateghtɨ, nɨ ua 15plan azenibar ikegh gɨn ovengam.
Egh kɨ nɨn akuragh, Asiriabar atrivimɨn amamangatɨghtɨ, a nɨ abɨragh Jerusalem inighan kogham. Bar puvatɨgham.
“ ‘Kɨ Ikiavɨra Itir God, kɨ ababanitam nɨ danightɨ, nɨ kamagh fogh suam, kɨ damuasa akam akɨrigha gɨvazir bizim, kɨ a damuam.

Nɨ gan! Ababanir kam kamakɨn, Atrivim Ahas fomɨra ingarigha asarazir adɨrɨziam, ia an dughuazibar gara aruemɨn auaba medi. Aruem datɨrɨghɨn ghuaghiri, eghtɨ kɨ a damightɨ, a tɨmɨra uamategh overiamɨn mangɨtɨ, an angazangarimɨn dughuazim adɨrɨziamɨn 10plan ighuvibar pɨn uamategh ghuavanabogham.’ ”38:8 Judabar arazim kamaghɨn. Atrivim Ahas asarazir adɨrɨziam, a men kloghɨn mɨn iti. Aruem an garima, an dughuazim, adɨrɨziar ighuvibar gisira, ezɨ me dughuazim gara fo, kar auan manam.
Ezɨ Hesekia ua ghuamaghegha akar kam osira ghaze:
Kɨ kamaghɨn uabɨ gɨnɨghnɨgha ghaze, kɨ ti uan igiamram aremegh nguazir kam ategham.
Kɨ ghaze, kɨ gumazamizir angamɨra itibar tongɨn ikɨ ua Ikiavɨra Itir Godɨn ganighan kogham.
Nan angamɨra itir ikɨrɨmɨrir kam, mati averpenim,
Kɨ dɨmagaribar nɨghnɨgha ghua mɨzarazibar tu, egha ghaze,
Kɨ mɨzazim isa ara deima, nan arareba gavgaviba puvatɨ,
Egh kɨ manmaghɨra mɨkɨmam? Ikiavɨra Itir God, nan akurvaghasa akam akɨrigha gɨfa,
O Ekiam, nɨ ikɨrɨmɨrim isɨ gumazamizibar anɨngtɨ,
Ezɨ osɨmtɨzir ekiar na bativiba, kɨ dar gara fo,
Gumazamizir Oveaghuezibar Nguibamɨn itiba,
Gumazamizir angamɨra ikiavɨra itiba,
Ikiavɨra Itir God nan akuragha na gamizɨ kɨ ua ghuamaghe.

Aisaia faragha kamaghɨn mɨgɨa ghaze, “Atrivimɨn ingangarir gumaziba, fighɨn ovɨzir me apuzizɨ taba inigh, da mɨrmɨrigh dɨpatam darugh da munumigh da inigh izɨ, Hesekian okar gavgavim dukuaghtɨ, a ua deragham.”
Ezɨ Hesekia faragha uaghan kamaghɨn Aisaian azara, “Ikiavɨra Itir God, ababanir manam nan akaghtɨ, kɨ an ganigh fogh suam, kɨ uam an Dɨpenimɨn mangɨ, an ziam fam?”
